sentences:
The Cyrenaics or Kyrenaics (; Kyrēnaïkoí ) were a sensual hedonist Greek school of philosophy founded in the 4th century BCE , supposedly by Aristippus of Cyrene , although many of the principles of the school are believed to have been formalized by his grandson of the same name , Aristippus the Younger .
The school was so called after Cyrene , the birthplace of Aristippus .
It was one of the earliest Socratic schools .
The Cyrenaics taught that the only intrinsic good is pleasure , which meant not just the absence of pain ( as it did for Epicurus ) , but positively enjoyable sensations .
Of these , momentary pleasures , especially physical ones , are stronger than those of anticipation or memory .
They did , however , recognize the value of social obligation and that pleasure could be gained from altruistic behaviour .
The school died out within a century and was replaced by the philosophy of Epicureanism .
